cyclone.name: EMILY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving east across central Florida today, then turning northeast and accelerating offshore parallel to the southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Florida peninsula near the Tampa Bay area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Anclote River to Englewood on the west coast of Florida
weather_observation.impacted_coast: central Florida from Tampa Bay eastward to Cape Canaveral, then north-northeast along the southeast U.S. coastline toward the Outer Banks
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds up to near tropical-storm force (peak probability 17% for 39-mph winds) possible Tuesday morning as the system exits across the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1â€“2 inches with localized amounts up to 4 inches possible, leading to minor ponding or brief roadway flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief thunderstorms with lightning and reduced visibility in heavy downpours may interrupt cargo and passenger movements.
